: As I said, Shibuya's full of softies. It's harsher in other areas, usually. (Though I can't say they quite match up to the... utter craziness of this place.) When I finished my weak, the Composer said I didn't earn enough points to go back to life, so I could either replay or become a reaper. That week was hell though, and I obviously didn't want to go through all that again. So here we are.
: ...all things considered, this place isn't so bad. I don't think it's a bad UG to land in if you die.
points to himself and shrugs for his backstory
: ... Hm. So ya wanted ta live, then? Had ya the choice.
: Probably. My life was pretty good before I died if you asked me.
was studying Grizz beforehand but he had literally no idea as to what he meant.
: Since I became a reaper though I took the chance to just get a fresh start instead.
: If it was so good-- then why'd ya want a fresh start?

: I'm pretty sure I was in the static plane for a good while, so they already had a funeral and all that. Really hard to explain to your parents suddenly being alive again, if you know what I mean. Friends would've noticed it too, so yeah.
: Anyways, my current life's pretty relaxing. Get to travel a lot so... can't complain.
: I'd probably be holed up in some office if I kept with my previous life, so.

: Yeah. ... Huh. An' I figured they jus' rewrote shi' so that erryone fergot, if ya came back ta life. I guess that'd put a good wrench in things tho-- if yer a Reaper, I dun' suppose they would change nothin', since yer still dead.
: Still a land of opportunity, so. The reaper life isn't so bad, you just have to work a bit more and there's a few things you miss out on, but you get used to it after a while.
: ......... What sorta things do ya miss out on?
: ...I guess I could word it as more private stuff.
not that I'd complain about it, since I don't particularly care.
